alert.note: Alert for Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:12PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Page, including Lake Powell, in Coconino County through 445 PM MST... At 410 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Powell, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Page, Big Five, LeChee, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Wahweap and Antelope Creek Basin. This includes the following highways... State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 545 and 554. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Powell, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
